meanings.definition: Something that is involved as a necessary part or consequence.
meanings.sent1: The entailments of the decision were far-reaching.
meanings.sent2: She considered the entailments of her actions before proceeding.
meanings.sent3: The mix-up at the party led to some amusing entailments.
meanings.sent4: The entailments of his speech echoed through the room.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the entailments of the experiment with vivid examples.

meanings.sent1: The entailments of the will were complex.
meanings.sent2: He handled the entailments of the estate with care.
meanings.sent3: The comical entailments of the inheritance surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The entailments of the contract bound them together.
meanings.sent5: The lawyer explained the entailments of property ownership in a memorable way.

meanings.definition: A legal situation regarding the inheritance of property.
meanings.sent1: The entailments of the lawsuit were unclear at first.
meanings.sent2: She navigated the entailments of the family inheritance.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected entailments of the will left them puzzled.
meanings.sent4: The entailments of the legal battle weighed heavily on them.
meanings.sent5: The judge explained the entailments of the case in a simple manner.
